message.p: Wt's video support is work in progress, but there are already a few ways to play video in Wt. Currently, methods based on the HTML5 Video element and Flash are provided.
The trailer below is Sintel, (c) copyright Blender Foundation | durian.blender.org

Below is a WHTML5Video class, with a WImage (a static JPEG image) as fallback. The HTML5 video will play on browsers that support MP4 or OGV video streams (firefox, chrome, safari, ...), and show the image on other browsers (Internet Explorer, opera, ...).

For browsers that support HTML5 video, the video below looks exactly like the one above. On other browsers, the player below falls back to a Flash player, which plays an MP4 video. If flash is not supported on your system, a static image is shown.
The Flash-based video player can be any player. The example below uses FLV Player as fallback for HTML5 video, but any flash player can do the job.
